sen.j: 神楽歌（かぐらうた）は、神楽でうたわれる歌である。
sen.e: Kagurauta are songs performed in Kagura (sacred music and dancing performed at shrines)
Kagurauta are songs performed in Kagura (sacred music and dancing performed at shrines)
Kagurauta is a song performed in Kagura (sacred music and dancing performed at shrines).
sen.cmt: 単数形にして、Kagurauta is a song としました。

sen.j: 概要
今日知られるものは以下の37曲である。
sen.e: The following 37 songs are known today.
The following 37 songs are known today.
The following 37 songs are known today.

sen.j: 庭燎（にはび）
阿知女（あちめ）
sen.cmt: 次セルに説明が続くことより、コロンを追加しました。

sen.j: ー厳密に言えば,「作法」といって,歌曲ではない。
sen.e: To be precise, the Achime is not a song but refers to rules of etiquette.
To be precise, the Achime is not a song but refers to rules of etiquette.
To be precise, the Achime is not a song but refers to rules of etiquette.

sen.j: 採物歌
sen.cmt: 次セルに説明が続くことより、コロンを追加しました。

sen.j: ー榊（さかき）、幣（みてぐら）、杖（つゑ）、篠（ささ）、弓（ゆみ）、剣（たち）、鉾（ほこ）、※（外字。左に「木」、右に「夕」。ひさご）、葛（かつら）、韓神（からかみ）。
sen.e: Sakaki,Mitegura,Tsue, Sasa (bamboo grasses), Yumi (a bow), Tachi (a sword), Hoko (a decorative float used in festival), (Foreign writing: The left hand of its Chinese character is"木" and the right hand is "夕." Hisago), kazura (vines), Karakami.

Sakaki,Mitegura,Tsue, Sasa (bamboo grasses), Yumi (a bow), Tachi (a sword), Hoko (a decorative float used in festival), (Foreign writing: The left hand of its Chinese character is"木" and the right hand is "夕." Hisago), kazura (vines), Karakami.
Sakaki,Mitegura,Tsue, Sasa (bamboo grasses), Yumi (a bow), Tachi (a sword), Hoko (a decorative float used in festival), Hisago, katsura (vines), Karakami.
sen.cmt: 「ひさご」の外字の説明ですが、英語には必要ないのではないかと思い、削除しました。

sen.j: 人長がこれらのものを取って舞ったから、採物歌と名付けられた。
sen.e: This song is given the name of Torimono-uta because the Songnincho (chief kagura dancer) took these tools when dancing.
This song is given the name of Torimono-uta because the Songnincho (chief kagura dancer) took these tools when dancing.
This song is given the name of Torimono-uta because the nincho (chief kagura dancer) took these tools when dancing.

sen.j: 大前張
sen.cmt: 次セルに説明が続くことより、コロンを追加しました。

sen.j: ー宮人（みやびと）、木綿志手（ゆふしで）、難波潟（なにはがた）、前張（さいはり）、階香取（しなかとり）
小前張
sen.cmt: 次セルに説明が続くことより、コロンを追加しました。

sen.j: ー薦枕（こもまくら）、閑野（しづや）、磯等前（いそらがさき）、篠波（ささなみ）、埴舂（うゑつき）、総角（あげまき）、大宮（おおみや）、湊田（みなとだ）、蟋蟀（きりぎりす）、千歳（せんざい）（一説に「千歳」を除く）、
sen.e: Komomakura, Shizuya, Isoragasaki, Sasanami, Uetsuki, Agemaki, Omiya, Minatoda, Kirigirisu, Senzai (Some suggest that "Senzai" is excluded.)
Komomakura, Shizuya, Isoragasaki, Sasanami, Uetsuki, Agemaki, Omiya, Minatoda, Kirigirisu, Senzai (Some suggest that "Senzai" is excluded.)
Komomakura, Shizuya, Isoragasaki, Sasanami, Uetsuki, Agemaki, Omiya, Minatoda, Kirigirisu, Senzai (Some suggest that 'Senzai' is excluded.)

sen.j: 早歌（はやうた）
星三種
sen.cmt: 次セルに説明が続くことより、コロンを追加しました。

sen.j: ー吉吉利利（ききりり）、得銭子（とくせんこ）、木綿作（ゆふつくる）
雑歌
sen.cmt: 次セルに説明が続くことより、コロンを追加しました。

sen.j: ー昼目（ひるめ）、立弓（ゆだち）、朝倉（あさくら）、其駒（そのこま）（一説に「千歳」を加える）、
sen.e: Hirume, Yudachi, Asakura, Sonokoma (Some suggest that "Senzai" is included.)
Hirume, Yudachi, Asakura, Sonokoma (Some suggest that "Senzai" is included.)
Hirume, Yudachi, Asakura, Sonokoma (Some suggest that 'Senzai' is included.)

sen.j: 竈殿歌（かまどのうた）
酒殿歌（さかどのうた）
うたはおおむね31字で、奈良時代以後の調である。
sen.e: The songs generally consist of 31 characters with a melody written in and after the Nara Period.
The songs generally consist of 31 characters with a melody written in and after the Nara Period.
The songs generally consist of 31 characters with a melody written in and after the Nara period.
sen.cmt: period 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 「宮人」以下の歌曲は、もとは催馬楽であった。
sen.e: "Miyabito" and the songs listed below it were originally Saibara (of a genre of Heian-period Japanese court music (primarily consisting of gagaku-styled folk melodies)).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: "Miyabito" and the songs listed below it were originally Saibara (of a genre of Heian-period Japanese court music (primarily consisting of gagaku-styled folk melodies)).
The song called 'Miyabito' and those listed below it were originally Saibara (of a genre of Heian-period Japanese court music (primarily consisting of gagaku-styled folk melodies)).
sen.cmt: 文頭の表現を変更しました。" → ' としました。

sen.j: その後、神楽の余興に催馬楽を歌い興じたから神楽歌のなかに混入したものである。
sen.e: These songs later belonged to the genre of Kagurauta song because they were performed as a side show of Kagura.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: These songs later belonged to the genre of Kagurauta song because they were performed as a side show of Kagura.
These songs later belonged to the genre of Kagurauta song because they were performed as a side show of Kagura.

sen.j: 現今行なわれるのは17曲である。
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: とりわけ「閑野」、「磯等前」は祈年、新嘗におこなわれ、「昼目」は秘曲として大嘗祭にかぎっておこなわれるという。
sen.e: In particular, "Shizuya" and "Isoragasaki" are said to be performed in Kinensai (prayer service for a good crop) and Niname-sai festival, and "Hirume" only in Daijo-sai festival (a festival to celebrate the succession of an emperor) as a secret music.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処祈年、新嘗には祈年祭り、新嘗祭りの際にと訳してあります。
sen.e: In particular, "Shizuya" and "Isoragasaki" are said to be performed in Kinensai (prayer service for a good crop) and Niname-sai festival, and "Hirume" only in Daijo-sai festival (a festival to celebrate the succession of an emperor) as a secret music.

In particular, 'Shizuya' and 'Isoragasaki' are said to be performed in Kinen-sai (prayer service for a good crop) and Niiname-sai (ceremonial offering by the Emperor of newly-harvested rice to the deities) festival, and 'Hirume' only in Daijo-sai festival (a festival to celebrate the succession of an emperor) as a secret music.
sen.cmt: 新嘗祭 の補足を追加しました。
